document.docName: Huber_Kwapong_2013Pholcid spiders from the Lower Guinean region of Central Africa .pdf.imf (Done).imf
document.masterDocTitle: West African pholcid spiders: an overview, with descriptions of five new species (Araneae, Pholcidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: West African pholcid spiders: an overview, with descriptions of five new species (Araneae, Pholcidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
22.
Physocyclus globosus (Taczanowski, 1874)
. Guinea, Ivory Coast ( Millot 1941 ); newly recorded for Sierra Leone, Liberia, Ghana, Togo, and Benin.

GUINEA : Guinée Forestière : 2 ♂♂ 3 ♀♀ 1 juv . in ZFMK ( Ar 10499 ), Lola , in building ( 7°48.5’N , 8°30.9’W ),
490 m
a.s.l.,
30 Nov. 2008
( B.A. Huber )
.

SIERRA LEONE : ~ 25 ♂♂ 35 ♀♀ (5 vials) in MRAC ( 146489, 148459, 148462, 148541, 159145 ), Freetown , Mount Aureol [ 8°28.7’N , 13°13.3’W ],
Sep. 1976
-
Nov. 1977
( D. Olu-Pitt )
.
LIBERIA : Montserrado Co. : 4 ♂♂ 6 ♀♀ + juvs (6 vials) in USNM , Monrovia ( 6°19’N , 10°48’W ),
Jun. 1894
-
Mar. 1895
( O.F. Cook )
;
1 ♀ 2 juvs in USNM , Mt. Coffee [ 6°31.7’N , 10°33.4’W ],
Apr. 1897
( O.F. Cook )
.
Maryland Co. : 2 ♀♀ + juvs in USNM , Muhlenberg Mission ( 4°28’N , 7°35’W ),
Feb. 1895
( G.P. Goff )
;
1 ♀ 1 juv. in USNM , same locality,
Jun. 1892
( O.F. Cook )
;
1 ♀ in USNM , unidentified locality: Liberia , “N.Y. settlement” ,
Mar. 1895
( J.S. Sharp )
.

IVORY COAST : 1 ♀ in MRAC ( 201102 ), Adiopo Doumé [ 5°20’N , 4°20’W ], Orstom , around buildings ,
12 Nov. 1994
( R. Jocqué )
;
1 ♂ in MRAC ( 177559 ), Appouesso , Forêt classée de la Bossematié [ 6°35’N , 3°28’W ],
Nov. 1993
( R. Jocqué )
;
4 ♂♂ 2 ♀♀ 1 juv. in CAS , Parc National de la Maraoué [~ 7°05’N , 6°05’W ],
8 Jan. 1991
( W.J. Pulawski )
;
1 ♀ in MRAC ( 230443 ), Taï Forest, Centre de Recherche Ecologique (CRE) [ 5°50’N , 7°21’W ], no further data
.

GHANA : Greater Accra Region : 2 ♀♀ 2 juvs in MRAC ( 131433 ), Accra [~ 5°35’N , 0°12’W ],
2-8 Oct. 1966
( D. Thys van den Audenaerde )
;
1 ♂ in MRAC ( 127241 ), same locality,
20 Jul. 1964
( G. Marlier )
;
1 ♀ in MRAC ( 142391 ), Legon [ 5°39’N , 0°10’W ],
14 Mar. 1972
( J. Edmunds )
;
2 ♂♂ 7 ♀♀ + juvs (6 vials) in MCZ ( 34030-35 )
,
Achimota [ 5°37’N , 0°14’W ], in and around house ,
Mar. 1961
-
Mar. 1962
( C.P. Hinckley )
.
Western Region : 1 ♂ 1 juv. in ZFMK ( Ar 10500 ),
Ankasa National Park
( 5°13.0’N , 2°39.1’W ),
180 m
a.s.l., buildings near entrance ,
22 Feb. 2013
( B.A. Huber )
.
Central Region : 1 ♀ in ZFMK ( Ar 10501 ), Cape Coast ( 5°06.3’N , 1°14.8’W ),
15 m
a.s.l., in building ,
23 Feb. 2013
( B.A. Huber )
.
Eastern Region : 5 ♂♂ 3 ♀♀ 1 juv. in ZFMK ( Ar 10502 ), near Mpraeso ( 6°34.1’N , 0°43.9’W ),
370 m
a.s.l., degraded forest near road, at rocks ,
10 Mar. 2013
( B.A. Huber )
;
3 ♀♀ 1 juv. in pure ethanol, in ZFMK ( Gha 151 ), same data
;
1 ♀ 1 juv. in CAS , Nkawkaw [ 6°33’N , 0°46’W ],
31 Jan. 1991
( W.J. Pulawski )
;
1 ♂ in MRAC ( 127253 ), Akosombo [ 6°16’N , 0°03’E ],
12 Jul. 1964
( G. Marlier )
.
Ashanti Region : 4 ♂♂ 3 ♀♀ in ZFMK ( Ar 10503 ), Kumawu ( 6°54.3’N , 1°15.4’W ),
380 m
a.s.l., in building ,
3 Mar. 2013
( B.A. Huber )
;
1 ♀ in MRAC ( 131424 ), Kumasi [ 6°41’N , 1°37’W ],
24-25 Sep. 1966
( D. Thys van den Audenaerde )
.

caption.paragraph:
Figs 31-32. Known distributions of the genera
Physocyclus Simon, 1893
and
Smeringopina Kraus, 1957
in West Africa.

subSubSection.paragraph:
TOGO : several ♂♂ ♀♀ (3 vials) in MRAC ( 136122-123, 150069 ), Kolokope [ 7°28’N , 1°19’E ],
26-31 Jul. 1969
( F. Puylaert )
;
1 ♀ 2 juvs in MRAC ( 131453 ), “ Doteleopé ”,
6-7 Oct. 1966
( D. Thys van den Audenaerde )
;
1 ♀ in MRAC ( 212772 ), Dzogbégan [ 7°14’N , 0°41’E ],
Jan. 2003
( S. Tchibozo )
.
BENIN : 1 ♂ in MRAC ( 212766 part), Adjohoun [ 6°42’N , 2°30’E ], in house ,
23 Dec. 2002
( S. Tchibozo )
;
2 ♀♀ 1 juv. in MRAC ( 212769 ), Godomey [ 6°25’N , 2°19’E ], in house ,
Dec. 2002
( S. Tchibozo )
;
2 ♀♀ in ZFMK ( Ar 10504 ), Niaouli ( 6°44’N , 2°08’E ),
20 Feb. 2009
( S. Tchibozo )
.

NIGERIA : Osun : 1 ♂ 1 ♀ 1 juv. in MRAC ( 174602 part), Ile-Ife, Obafemi Awolowo Univ. campus [ 7°28’N , 4°34’E ], 1991 ( H. Segers )
.
